result.content: In the solution of tutorial of this problem, levels are represented by vertices and transfers are represented by edges. Graph also has a start vertex. It says that the result is a minimum spanning tree of the graph. I couldn't understand why the answer is a minimum spanning tree. Can't a vertex of a minimum spanning tree have more than one adjacent vertex which is impossible for a tree to be the result? Can someone explain where I'm wrong?
